availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Henry Camp (New York City, New York, music director, soldier, and attorney)

body.p: New York City, New York, music director, soldier, and attorney. Norwalk, Connecticut, native. Married to Anna Armstrong Camp in 1847. Father of Eliza Camp, Isabel Camp, Arreta Camp, and Mary Camp. Served as a music director at several New York City churches. Private in the 71st New York State Militia from April 1861 to July 1861. Partner at Nettleton, Gilbert, & Camp law firm from 1861 to 1865. Member of the Republican Party.

bibl.p: Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedule, New York, New York City, Ward 16, District 14, p. 37; "Obituary: Henry Camp," The Brooklyn Daily Eagle (Brooklyn, N.Y.), June 26, 1909, p. 2; M. Quad, Field, Fleet, and Fort (Detroit: Detroit Free Press Publishing, 1885), p. 84-5; Compiled Service Records of Volunteer Union Soldiers who Served in Organizations From the State of New York, NARA RG 94, Microfilm Series M551, Roll 0021.
